file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 27-35-03-04 - ELEVATOR LOAD CELL - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL ELEVATOR LOAD CELL - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ONLY FOR AIRCRAFTS WITH LOAD CELLS 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the elevator load cell. B. These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH assemblage. C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ONLY FOR AIR- CRAFTS WITH LOAD 27-35-03-000-801-A ELEVATOR LOAD CELL - REMOVAL CELLS ONLY FOR AIR- CRAFTS WITH LOAD 27-35-03-400-801-A ELEVATOR LOAD CELL - INSTALLATION CELLS EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 27-35-03 Page 1 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-35-03-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ONLY FOR AIRCRAFTS WITH LOAD CELLS 2. ELEVATOR LOAD CELL - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the elevator load cell assembled between the control column and forward torque tube. (2) This task is applicable only to aircraft equipped with the load cell. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 25-11-01-000-801-A/400 PILOT SEAT - REMOVAL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 123BL Area below the cockpit floor 220 221EF Cockpit LH upper side 220 222FF Cockpit RH upper side D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To lock the elevator control system in the GSE 058 Kit, rig pins, flight controls neutral position E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Below the cockpit floor I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Make sure that the aircraft is de-energized and safe for maintenance. (2) Remove the pilot seat (AMM TASK 25-11-01-000-801-A/400). (3) Install the rig pins to the elevator control system, to lock it in the neutral position. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-35-03 Page 2 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Do the procedure given below to the LH and RH elevator load cell. (2) Disconnect the electrical connector (19). (3) Disconnect the end of the load cell (10) from the bellcrank at the torque tube. For this, remove the cotter pin (17), nut (16), washers (15), bolt (12), lock washer (13), washer (14), bonding strap (11) and bushing (18). (4) Disconnect the end of the load cell (10) from the control column. For this, remove the cotter pin (6), nut (5), washers (7), bolt (1), lock washer (2), washer (3), bonding strap (8) and bushing (4) and (9). (5) Remove the load cell (10). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-35-03 Page 3 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ONLY FOR AIRCRAFTS WITH LOAD CELLS Elevator Load Cell - Removal/Installation Figure 401 ZONE 123 A 1. BOLT B 2. LOCK WASHER 3. WASHER 8. BONDING STRAP 4. BUSHING 5. NUT 9. BUSHING DET. A 10. LOAD CELL C 11. BONDING STRAP 7. WASHER (2x) D 12. BOLT D 6. COTTERPIN 13. LOCK WASHER 14. WASHER 18. BUSHING 19. ELECTRICAL BONDING STRAP CONNECTOR (REF.) DET. B 15. WASHER (2x) 1 20. NUT 16. NUT 17. COTTERPIN 22. LOCK WASHER LOAD CELL (REF.) 177.0 (6.97) VIEW C DET. D 21. LOCK WIRE DIMENSIONS: mm (in.). (TYP.) 1 TORQUE: 10.2 N.m (90 lb.in) MAXIMUM EM145AMM270610C.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-35-03 Page 4 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-35-03-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ONLY FOR AIRCRAFTS WITH LOAD CELLS 3. ELEVATOR LOAD CELL - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the elevator load cell assembled between the control column and forward torque tube. (2) This task is applicable only to aircraft equipped with the load cell. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 20-10-01/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AMM TASK 25-11-01-400-801-A/400 PILOT SEAT - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - AMM TASK 31-31-00-700-804-A/500 FLIGHT DATA RECORDER - FUNCTIONAL TEST IPC 27-31-00 ELEVATOR PRIMARY MECHANICAL CONTROL C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 123 123BL Area below the cockpit floor 220 221EF Cockpit LH upper side 220 222FF Cockpit RH upper side D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To lock the elevator control system in the GSE 058 Kit, rig pinst, flight controls neutral position E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MS20995C20 Lockwire AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Cotter pin IPC 27-31-00 2 EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-35-03 Page 5 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Below the cockpit floor I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Make sure that the dimension of the load cell is as given in (Figure 401), to make the installation easier. If it is not, adjust the load cell rod ends as follows: WARNING:USE EYE PROTECTION WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE OR SAFETY CABLE. IF YOU DO NOT USE EYE PROTECTION, CUT PIECES OF WIRE CAN HIT YOUR EYES AND CAUSE INJURY. CAUTION: DO NOT LET PIECES OF DISCARDED LOCK WIRE STAY IN THE WORK AREA. IF NECESSARY, USE A VACUUM CLEANER TO REMOVE THEM. (a) Remove and discard the lockwire (21). (b) Loosen the nut (20) and the lock washer (22). (c) Adjust the load cell (10) to get the correct dimension. (d) Put the lock washer (22) in the correct position in the load cell (10). (e) Apply a maximum torque of 10.2 N.m (90 lb.in) to the nut (20). WARNING:USE EYE PROTECTION WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE OR SAFETY CABLE. IF YOU DO NOT USE EYE PROTECTION, CUT PIECES OF WIRE CAN HIT YOUR EYES AND CAUSE INJURY. CAUTION: DO NOT LET PIECES OF DISCARDED LOCK WIRE STAY IN THE WORK AREA. IF NECESSARY, USE A VACUUM CLEANER TO REMOVE THEM. (f) Safety the nut (20) and lock washer (22) with lockwire (21) AMM MPP 20-10-01/200. (2) Put the load cell (9) in its installation position and try to install the bolt (12) and bolt (1). (a) If the load cell (9) is not in the correct length, adjust the load cell rod ends as follows: WARNING: USE EYE PROTECTION WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE OR SAFETY CABLE. IF YOU DO NOT USE EYE PROTECTION, CUT PIECES OF WIRE CAN HIT YOUR EYES AND CAUSE INJURY. CAUTION: DO NOT LET PIECES OF DISCARDED LOCK WIRE STAY IN THE WORK AREA. IF NECESSARY, USE A VACUUM CLEANER TO REMOVE THEM. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-35-03 Page 6 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL 1 Remove and discard the lockwire (21). 2 Loosen the nut (20) and the lock washer (22). 3 Adjust the load cell (10) to get the correct dimension. 4 Put the lock washer (22) in the correct position in the load cell (10). 5 Apply a maximum torque of 10.2 N.m (90 lb.in) to the nut (20). WARNING: USE EYE PROTECTION WHEN YOU REMOVE OR INSTALL LOCKWIRE OR SAFETY CABLE. IF YOU DO NOT USE EYE PROTECTION, CUT PIECES OF WIRE CAN HIT YOUR EYES AND CAUSE INJURY. CAUTION: DO NOT LET PIECES OF DISCARDED LOCK WIRE STAY IN THE WORK AREA. IF NECESSARY, USE A VACUUM CLEANER TO REMOVE THEM. 6 Safety the nut (20) and lock washer (22) with lockwire (21) AMM MPP 20-10-01/200. (b) If the load cell (9) is in the correct length, go to step (3). (3) Install the bolt (12), lock washer (13), washer (14), bonding strap (11), washers (15), bushing (18) and nut (16) to attach the load cell at the forward torque tube. (4) Install a new cotter pin (17). (5) Install the bolt (1), lock washer (2), washer (3), bonding strap (8), washers (7), bushing (4) and (9), and nut (5), to attach the load cell at the control column. (6) Install a new cotter pin (6). (7) Install the electrical connector (19). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the rig pins from the elevator control system. (2) Do the load cell functional test ( AMM TASK 31-31-00-700-804-A/500). (3) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness (AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600). NOTE: The inspection of fuel quantity indication harness is part of Critical Design Configuration Control Limitations (CDCCL) in the Airworthiness Limitations of the Aircraft Maintenance Program. (4) Install the pilot seat (AMM TASK 25-11-01-400-801-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-35-03 Page 7 of 7 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A.
